Uses of Class
nzilbb.ag.util.Validator

  • Packages that use Validator 
    Package Description
    nzilbb.ag.util
    Utility classes for processing annotation graphs.

    • Uses of Validator in nzilbb.ag.util

      Methods in nzilbb.ag.util that return Validator 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Validator Merger.getValidator()
      Getter for Merger.validator: The validator to use after merge is complete, or null to not validate the graph after merge.
      Validator Validator.setDebug​(boolean newDebug)
      Setter for debug: Whether a log of messages should be kept for reporting.
      Validator Validator.setDefaultAnchorConfidence​(Integer newDefaultAnchorConfidence)
      Setter for defaultAnchorConfidence: Value to assume in the case of Anchors that have no value for "confidence".
      Validator Validator.setDefaultOffsetThreshold​(Integer newDefaultOffsetThreshold)
      Setter for defaultOffsetThreshold: The confidence threshold for default anchor offset computation, or null to skip default offset computation.
      Validator Validator.setErrors​(Vector<String> newErrors)
      Setter for errors: Fatal errors raised during the last transform(Graph).
      Validator Validator.setFullValidation​(boolean newFullValidation)
      Setter for fullValidation: Whether to validate all annotations on all layers (true) or perform a 'smart' validation tries to validate only parts of the graph that have actually changed (false - the default).
      Validator Validator.setMaxLabelLength​(Integer newMaxLabelLength)
      Setter for maxLabelLength: Maximum allowed label length, or null for no limit.
      Methods in nzilbb.ag.util with parameters of type Validator 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Merger Merger.setValidator​(Validator newValidator)
      Setter for Merger.validator: The validator to use after merge is complete, or null to not validate the graph after merge.
